snippet: A platinum-iridium cylinder in France is the official standard for weight, but in 134 years it has gained a little weight, a fraction of that of a grain of sand.
abstract: International Prototype Kilogram, platinum-iridium cylinder in France that has been official standard for kilogram weight for 134 years, has gained tiny amount of weight in that time, likely from mercury contamination or growth of layer of hydrocarbons on its surface.
lead_paragraph: A platinum-iridium cylinder in France is the official standard for weight, but in 134 years it has gained a little weight, a fraction of that of a grain of sand.

headline.seo: Making Sure That a Kilo Is Always a Kilo
headline.main: Making Sure That a Kilo Is Always a Kilo

keywords.value: International Bureau of Weights and Measures
